contextId.information: The abstract noun "justice" can be translated using the verb "judge." AT: "judge rightly" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

Yahweh is speaking to Jeremiah. Living among liars is spoken of as if it were living in the middle of deception.  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])[[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: Your dwelling is in the midst of deception

contextId.information: This refers to wicked people. AT: "wicked people" or "those who are wicked" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The quality that marks false prophecies is spoken of as if it were itself a prophecy. AT: "prophesy deceitfully" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The word "mourning" can be translated with a verbal phrase. AT: "where people are mourning" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
AT: "will become something that horrifies people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The abstract noun "justice" can be stated as an action. AT: "Always treat the people whom you rule over fairly" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: Bring about justice in the morning

contextId.information: The abstract nouns "justice" and "righteousness can be stated as actions. AT: "Act fairly and justly" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The fact that Yahweh is angry is spoken of as if it were an object. AT: "Yahweh is angry" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

The abstract noun "abundance" can be translated as "many good things." The lives of the priests are spoken of as if they were a field that would become completely wet when much rain falls on it. Life is a metonym for the person. AT: "I will give the priests all the good things they would like" or "I will satisfy the priests with good things" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: will saturate the lives of the priests in abundance

contextId.information: These abstract nouns can be translated as verbs. AT: "people have no food to eat, and everyone is weak from being ill" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

The abstract noun "peace" is spoken of as if it were a solid object that one person could give to another, and the city is spoken of as a person who could receive a gift. AT: "the way I cause the people of the city to live in peace" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
contextId.quote: the peace that I will give to it

contextId.information: The abstract noun "dictation" can be translated as a verb. See how similar words are translated in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:36:04|36:4]]. AT: "while Jeremiah was speaking, Baruch wrote on it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: Baruch wrote on it at Jeremiah's dictation

contextId.information: "Let us present our urgent request to you." The abstract noun "pleas" can be stated as a verb. AT: "Listen to our pleas" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: Let our pleas come before you

contextId.information: The abstract noun "death" can be stated as "to kill" AT: "for you to cause the Chaldeans to either kill us or to take us as captives to Babylon" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: for you to cause our death and to make us captives in Babylon

contextId.information: The abstract noun "abominations" can be stated as "things he hated." AT: "because you did things that he hated" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: because of the abominations that you did

contextId.information: This can be restated to remove the abstract nouns "a desolation," "a horror," and "a curse." AT: "Then Yahweh caused it so that no one lives in the land. He made it a desolate and horrifying place. People use its name to curse others. And this is how it is even to this day" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: Then your land became a desolation, a horror, and a curse so there was no longer an inhabitant as at this present day

contextId.information: The abstract noun "groaning" can be stated as "crying." AT: "I am tired from crying" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
